title: Brilliant Font! Can anyone help me find the name of this?
content:
Hello Typographers

I am look for the name of the attached font as used in the WIRED Magazine Sampler for the UK (please see link below).

[http://www.wired.co.uk/promotions/sampler](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114182230/http:/www.wired.co.uk/promotions/sampler "http://www.wired.co.uk/promotions/sampler")

All help is welcome, thank you

Justin

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Start.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114182230/http:/typophile.com/files/Start_0.png) | 10.9 KB |
author: Champney

comments.content:
Oh, we had this one recently. I found an old film type in one of the Dan X. Solo books from Dover, and I think Mark Simonson knew of a digital version, but I cannot think of the name of either offhand. Arrgh!

- Mike Yanega

[Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114182230/http:/typophile.com/node/56721) is the link to the thread. It was identified by Mark as Zelek.

- Mike Yanega

See – [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114182230/http:/typophile.com/node/56721).

[EDIT] Oops. Mike found it himself.

In reading the link to the article about the WIRED issue, they say a font called Zorro was created using Zelek as the model. I'm assuming Zorro is not for commercial distribution, but I'm not sure about this.

- Mike Yanega

Thank you for all your feedback Mike, really helpful.

I emailed WIRED and got the following feedback and also found this link [http://www.spd.org/2009/03/new-work-wired-uk.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114182230/http:/www.spd.org/2009/03/new-work-wired-uk.php "http://www.spd.org/2009/03/new-work-wired-uk.php")

\>

Hello,

It's called Zorro.  
It's been drawn for us from a late 70's letraset font.

Cheers,

A

Yes, that must be the same catalog Mark was looking at. Thanks for posting the image.

- Mike Yanega
